description: From Hindi क़ुली (qulī) and Urdu قلی‎ (qulī, “hired laborer”), possibly from Ottoman Turkish قول‎ (kul, “servant”). Another theory says that it is named after a Gujarati tribe or caste of that name. Other forms occur in Bengali কুলি (kuli) and Tamil கூலி (kūli, “daily hire”). Possibly also influenced by Hindi कोली (kolī, “weaver; low-class”).
Mandarin 苦力 (kǔlì, “hard labor”) may have been influenced by cognates of the above Hindi word in other languages and may have further influenced English.

entries.meaning: An unskilled Asian worker, usually of Chinese or Indian descent; a labourer; a porter. Coolies were frequently transported to other countries in the 19th and early 20th centuries as indentured labourers.
examples: Coolie-identity is as much the product of self-perception as it is the construction of a category by those who did not belong to it. It is these constructions that historically constituted a coolie in the matrix of power relations which this essay seeks to partially comprehend.

entries.meaning: (offensive, Trinidad and Tobago, Caribbean, Guyana, Jamaica, South Africa and other parts of Africa) An Indian or a person of Indian descent.
